item.title: Prototyping an Online Recommender in Python
item.description: Overview Traditional recommendation systems, like Collaborative Filtering, are widely used but have limitations. They struggle with the cold-start problem (new users have no history) and rely heavily on long-term signals. They also often ignore short-term context such as time of day, device, location, or session intent, and can miss nuances, for example, a user wanting coffee in the morning but pizza at night. Contextual Multi-Armed Bandits (CMAB) address these gaps through online learning.
